description: ERECTION/REPLACEMENT FENCING TO ENCLOSE THE OPERATIONS COMPOUND OF MORDEN HALL PARK
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 22NT/L/0/01 Rev 02; 22NT/SITE/1/11 Rev 04; 22NT/SITE/1/12 Rev 03; 22NT/SITE/1/33 Rev 03; 22NT/SITE/1/34 Rev 03; 22NT/SITE/1/13

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document  'Arboricultural Method Statement Surrey Arms Project' shall be fully complied with, including the programme for site supervision by an arboricultural expert. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works.

Condition : 5 - The measures set out within approved document 22NT/SITE/1/13 shall be carried out as approved in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner.  Any trees which die within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, or removed or become seriously damaged or diseased or are dying, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of the same approved specification, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation

Condition : 6 - BIODIVERSITY: The biodiversity enhancement measures set out within approved document 22NT/SITE/1/13 shall be implemented during construction works and shall be permanently maintained as such thereafter. 

Reason: To enhance the biodiversity of the area in the interest of nature conservation and to comply with the following Development Plans policies for Merton:  Policy G6 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy and policy DM02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Any works/events carried out either by, or at the behest of, the developer, whether they are located on, or affecting a prospectively maintainable highway, as defined under Section 87 of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, or on or affecting the public highway, shall be co-ordinated under the requirements of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 and the Traffic management Act 2004 and licensed accordingly in order to secure the expeditious movement of traffic by minimising disruption to users of the highway network in Merton. Any such works or events commissioned by the developer and particularly those involving the connection of any utility to the site, shall be co-ordinated by them in liaison with the London Borough of Merton, Network Coordinator, (telephone 020 8545 3976). This must take place at least one month in advance of the works and particularly to ensure that statutory undertaker connections/supplies to the site are co-ordinated to take place wherever possible at the same time.

Condition : 8 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
subdivision_of_building: No buildings affected by the works, other than impact on curtilage.
site_name: Land To The Rear Of Surrey Arms And White Cottage
